properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain possible tonight and Thursday morning. Patchy freezing drizzle is forecast through this evening followed by a risk of freezing rain beginning near midnight or early Thursday morning. If freezing rain does develop, ice accumulations may be up to 2 millimeters in some locales. Freezing rain will come to an end on Thursday morning. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T10:28:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T18:29:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0539573534.2020
Area: Kirkland Lake - Englehart, Temiskaming Shores - Temagami, North Bay - Powassan - Mattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning into the afternoon. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 centimetres are expected with the heaviest snow falling this morning. The snow is forecast to end early this afternoon. Travel is expected to be impacted due to moderate to heavy snow. Motorists should be prepared for winter weather driving conditions. A risk of freezing drizzle will follow the snow into this evening, predominantly for locations in the vicinity of the Ottawa River. This freezing precipitation may make roads slippery overnight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T05:29:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T13:30:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3007067325.2020
Area: Gatineau, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault, Prescott and Russell, Petawawa - Pembroke - Cobden, Renfrew - Arnprior - Calabogie, Smiths Falls - Perth - Eastern Lanark County, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orléans, Ottawa South - Richmond - Metcalfe
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system will bring a mix of rain and snow to Southern Quebec overnight tonight. During the changeover from snow to rain, an area of freezing rain may be possible early Thursday morning. Freezing precipitation could make roads slippery Thursday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T12:51:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T20:52:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1961989536.2020

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice accretion from 1 to 2 millimetres are expected overnight tonight. The freezing rain will begin late this evening and end Thursday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T16:45:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-26T00:46:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1954791288.2020

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system will stall over the Central Coast Thursday and Friday and a long episode of heavy rain, with rainfall amounts in excess of 100 mm, is expected. Rain will begin Thursday morning over the Central Coast Inland region - including Bella Coola and will be continuous until easing Friday night. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T15:44:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T23:45:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3453510603.2020
Area: Central Coast - inland sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero over these regions tomorrow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T12:25:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T20:26:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3544522306.2020
Area: Ivujivik, Akulivik, Puvirnituq, Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intensifying low pressure system over northern Hudson Bay will lead to strong northeasterly winds over Coral Harbour beginning Thursday afternoon. The strong winds, with gusts up to 80 km/h, combined with fresh and falling snow, will lead to blizzard or near blizzard conditions that will persist into Friday before easing through the day. This winter storm watch may be upgraded to a blizzard warning as the event nears and conditions are monitored. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T12:32:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T20:33:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0415906492.2020
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 10 to 15 cm of snow is expected for Highway 97 and the Pine Pass on Thursday. A weather system will move into northern BC early Thursday morning bringing heavy snow to the region. Snow will likely continue into the early evening hours then taper off as the system slumps south. Gusty southwesterly winds may lead to localized areas of drifting snow which could reduce visibilities. Another system will affect the region on Friday with more snow expected. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T15:20:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T23:21:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3713660587.2020
Area: Highway 97 - Pine Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A low moving across the Yukon will spread heavy snow to Dawson and southern sections of the Dempster beginning tonight and continuing through Thursday. Gusty winds near the Richardson Mountains will also lead to local blowing snow over the Dempster overnight and Thursday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T14:57:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T22:58:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3380288168.2020
Area: Dawson, Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of heavy rain is forecast for the central coast of British Columbia for Thursday and Friday. A pair of frontal waves will make landfall in succession on the central coast of British Columbia Thursday and Friday. The total rainfall amount from these frontal waves is forecast to be approach 150 mm. The forecast heavy rain on top of antecedent moisture may result in localised flooding or road washouts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T16:40:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-26T00:41:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3806307656.2020
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain tonight into Thursday morning. A band of freezing rain will move across Eastern Ontario and a small part of Northeastern Ontario tonight. The freezing rain will change over to plain rain or drizzle Thursday morning as temperatures inch above the zero degree mark. Ice accumulation may be up to 2 millimetres in some locations tonight into early Thursday morning. Motorists should allow extra time to reach their destination. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T16:59:32-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Areas of dense fog will persist across the region tonight into Thursday morning, especially when little or no rain is falling. Motorists should allow extra time to reach their destination. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Advisory Alert Update - Civil Emergency
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage will continue until Thursday morning, with gusts near 100 km/h. Reduced visibility in blowing snow will also occur at times. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
